events.title: Eurovision 2025 Prediction Challenge
events.excerpt: Predict the Eurovision 2025 Grand Final Top‑10 live from the Julius Raab Heim common room and win House Points!
events.description: A one‑night House Event where each House submits a ranked Top‑10 prediction for the Eurovision Song Contest 2025 Grand Final. Scores are awarded on a closeness scale. The House with the highest end score pockets the full 100‑point House‑Event prize (2nd = 75, 3rd = 50, 4th = 25).

schedule.activity: Last song finishes – public voting opens
All Captains forward consolidated list to Host via WhatsApp
Broadcast ends - House ranking posted – clean‑up

details.participationInfo: Any registered Participant may enter. Talk to your House Captain and rank the 10 countries **before** the TV hosts close the phone lines (≈00:20 CEST).
rules: **List format:** 10 distinct countries, ranked 1 (winner) to 10. Example: ‘1 Switzerland, 2 Sweden, …, 10 Spain’.
**Deadline:** Discussions should end with your Captain before the ‘Stop voting now!’ call (~00:20 CEST, 18 May 2025).
**Captain submission:** Each Captain sends ONE WhatsApp to the Event Host by 00:25 CEST containing one finalised list of 10 countries in the agreed template (name followed by the 10‑country string).

**Scoring per list:**  
 • Exact place = 12 pts  
 • Off by 1 = 10 pts  
 • Off by 2 = 8 pts  
 • Off by 3 = 6 pts  
 • Off by 4 = 4 pts  
 • Correct country in Top‑10 but ≥5 away = 2 pts  
 • Country finishes outside Top‑10 = 0 pts.
**Tie‑breakers:** (a) House with the most Exact Places; (b) earliest Captain submission.

do: Wear your House colours for +1 attendance point (§11)
Arrive early to secure a good spot
Cheer loudly – but keep it receptionist-friendly
dont: Edit list after the TV ‘Stop voting’ announcement

events.whatsappInfo: Talk to your House Captain and help assemble the list before ~00:20. Captains WhatsApp the consolidated list to the Event Host by 00:25.

events.title: Le Coin Coin ~ Super Gambit ~
events.excerpt: Be the first team to finish both of your own glasses in this fast-paced and exciting coin game of skill and speed!
events.description: Gather your teammate and get ready for '~ Le Coin Coin ~'! The goal is simple: be the first team to finish both of your glasses. Precision throws and quick reflexes are key to victory in this super gambit.

details.participationInfo: Two teams of two players each. Register your team with the event organizers before 19:00. All Houses are welcome to participate and cheer!
rules: **Setup:** Each team stands on one side of a beer-pong sized table. Four filled glasses (0.5L, traditionally beer) are placed on each corner. One empty glass is placed in the exact center.
**Gameplay:** One player from Team A throws a ping-pong ball towards Team B's glasses.
**Drinking:** If the ball *touches* an opposing team's glass (in or out), the shooter’s teammate may start drinking one of their team’s glasses.
**Stopping:** Simultaneously, the opposing team must quickly retrieve the ball, place it in the empty center glass, and loudly say “STOP”. The drinker must immediately stop.
**Missed Shot:** If the ball doesn’t touch any opposing glass, nothing happens. The other team takes their turn.
**Shooter Never Drinks:** The player who threw the ball is not allowed to drink during that turn.
**Teammate Waits:** The shooter’s teammate cannot drink or touch a glass until the ball has touched an opponent's glass.
**Finished Glass:** Once a glass is completely empty, it must be flipped upside-down on the table and can no longer be targeted.
**Glass Knocked Over:** If a glass is knocked over (by a shot or by its own team), it must be refilled completely, even if nearly empty. It's then back in play.
**No Assigned Glasses:** Teammates can drink from either glass on their side. If one glass is finished, the remaining glass can be shared.
**Winning:** The first team to completely drink and flip both of their own glasses wins. Knocked-over glasses do not count as finished.
**Points:** This is a Super Gambit Game. Points will respect Act.12a of the “Amendment as of 4 April 2025” of the official “House Cup rules 2025”.
bringItems: 2 glasses worth of drinks per team per game
safetyInfo: Please drink responsibly. Non-alcoholic drinks are allowed.
Ensure fair play and good sportsmanship at all times.
In case of dispute, the decision of the House Cup judges is final.

do: Have fun and cheer for all teams!
dont: Argue excessively with opponents or judges.

events.whatsappInfo: For rule clarifications or disputes during the event, talk to Max.
